comments.body:
It wouldn't in a real scenario, but it could be unset in a test `context`.

For example `globals.artifacts` is nullable
https://github.com/flutter/flutter/blob/cf7ed18da1b34df95be6eab94e66b365f97ac483/packages/flutter_tools/lib/src/globals_null_migrated.dart#L39-L40
even though in theory it should always be set:
https://github.com/flutter/flutter/blob/7c5857d3b00f2dba36040d2e68cef79ca58071b1/packages/flutter_tools/lib/src/context_runner.dart#L133

and we also have a few of these that are expected to always be set, even by a test:
https://github.com/flutter/flutter/blob/cf7ed18da1b34df95be6eab94e66b365f97ac483/packages/flutter_tools/lib/src/globals_null_migrated.dart#L41-L42

I've had to track down g3 test failures where a test hit something like `globals.artifacts!` and failed because its context didn't set an artifact, because it was unrelated to the test.

I can make this `globals.cocoaPods!` if you prefer and fix up what breaks, if anything.
We should eventually make these non-nullable, but we can do that in the future when more stuff is migrated.

diffHunk:
@@ -1,1 +42,46 @@  );

  final bool didPodInstall = await globals.cocoaPods?.processPods(
    xcodeProject: xcodeProject,
    buildMode: buildMode,
